info.title: Trieve API
info.description: Trieve OpenAPI Specification. This document describes all of the operations available through the Trieve API.

get.description:
Login

This will redirect you to the OAuth provider for authentication with email/pass, SSO, Google, Github, etc.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: ID of organization to authenticate into

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: URL to redirect to after successful login

parameters.name: inv_code
parameters.description: Code sent via email as a result of successful call to send_invitation

303.description: Response that redirects to OAuth provider through a Location header to be handled by browser.

400.description: OAuth error likely with OIDC provider.

delete.description:
Logout

Invalidate your current auth credential stored typically stored in a cookie. This does not invalidate your API key.

204.description: Confirmation that your current auth token has been invalidated. This does not invalidate your API key.

get.description:
OpenID Connect callback

This is the callback route for the OAuth provider, it should not be called directly. Redirects to browser with set-cookie header.

200.description: Response that returns with set-cookie header

400.description: Email or password empty or incorrect

get.description:
Get Me

Get the user corresponding to your current auth credentials.

200.description: The user corresponding to your current auth credentials

400.description: Error message indicitating you are not currently signed in

post.summary: Create or Upsert Chunk or Chunks
post.description:
Create or Upsert Chunk or Chunks

Create a new chunk. If the chunk has the same tracking_id as an existing chunk, the request will fail. Once a chunk is created, it can be searched for using the search endpoint.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to create a new chunk (chunk)

200.description: JSON response payload containing the created chunk

400.description: Error typically due to deserialization issues

426.description: Error when upgrade is needed to process more chunks

put.description:
Update Chunk

Update a chunk. If you try to change the tracking_id of the chunk to have the same tracking_id as an existing chunk, the request will fail.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to update a chunk (chunk)

204.description: No content Ok response indicating the chunk was updated as requested

400.description: Service error relating to to updating chunk, likely due to conflicting tracking_id

post.description:
Generate suggested queries

This endpoint will generate 3 suggested queries based off the query provided in the request body and return them as a JSON object.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to get alternative suggested queries

200.description: A JSON object containing a list of alternative suggested queries

400.description: Service error relating to to updating chunk, likely due to conflicting tracking_id

post.description:
RAG on Specified Chunks

This endpoint exists as an alternative to the topic+message concept where our API handles chat memory. With this endpoint, the user is responsible for providing the context window and the prompt. See more in the "search before generate" page at docs.trieve.ai.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to perform RAG on some chunks (chunks)

200.description: This will be a JSON response of a string containing the LLM's generated inference. Response if not streaming.

400.description: Service error relating to to updating chunk, likely due to conflicting tracking_id

post.description:
Get Recommended Chunks

Get recommendations of chunks similar to the chunks in the request. Think about this as a feature similar to the "add to playlist" recommendation feature on Spotify. This request pairs especially well with our groups endpoint.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to get recommendations of chunks similar to the chunks in the request

200.description: Chunks with embedding vectors which are similar to those in the request body

400.description: Service error relating to to getting similar chunks

post.description:
Search

This route provides the primary search functionality for the API. It can be used to search for chunks by semantic similarity, full-text similarity, or a combination of both. Results' `chunk_html` values will be modified with `<b>` tags for sub-sentence highlighting.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to semantically search for chunks (chunks)

200.description: Chunks with embedding vectors which are similar to those in the request body

400.description: Service error relating to searching

put.description:
Update Chunk By Tracking Id

Update a chunk by tracking_id. This is useful for when you are coordinating with an external system and want to use the tracking_id to identify the chunk.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to update a chunk by tracking_id (chunks)

204.description: Confirmation that the chunk has been updated as per your request

400.description: Service error relating to to updating chunk

get.description:
Get Chunk By Tracking Id

Get a singular chunk by tracking_id. This is useful for when you are coordinating with an external system and want to use your own id as the primary reference for a chunk.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

parameters.name: tracking_id
parameters.description: tracking_id of the chunk you want to fetch

200.description: chunk with the tracking_id that you were searching for

400.description: Service error relating to fidning a chunk by tracking_id

delete.description:
Delete Chunk By Tracking Id

Delete a chunk by tracking_id. This is useful for when you are coordinating with an external system and want to use the tracking_id to identify the chunk. If deleting a root chunk which has a collision, the most recently created collision will become a new root chunk.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

parameters.name: tracking_id
parameters.description: tracking_id of the chunk you want to delete

204.description: Confirmation that the chunk with the tracking_id specified was deleted

400.description: Service error relating to finding a chunk by tracking_id

get.description:
Get Chunk By Id

Get a singular chunk by id.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

parameters.name: chunk_id
parameters.description: Id of the chunk you want to fetch.

200.description: chunk with the id that you were searching for

400.description: Service error relating to fidning a chunk by tracking_id

delete.description:
Delete Chunk

Delete a chunk by its id. If deleting a root chunk which has a collision, the most recently created collision will become a new root chunk.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

parameters.name: chunk_id
parameters.description: Id of the chunk you want to fetch.

204.description: Confirmation that the chunk with the id specified was deleted

400.description: Service error relating to finding a chunk by tracking_id

post.description:
Create Chunk Group

Create a new chunk_group. This is a way to group chunks together. If you try to create a chunk_group with the same tracking_id as an existing chunk_group, this operation will fail.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to cretea a chunkGroup

200.description: Returns the created chunkGroup

400.description: Service error relating to creating the chunkGroup

put.description:
Update Group

Update a chunk_group. If you try to change the tracking_id to one that already exists, this operation will fail.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to update a chunkGroup

204.description: Confirmation that the chunkGroup was updated

400.description: Service error relating to updating the chunkGroup

post.description:
Add Chunk to Group

Route to add a chunk to a group.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: Id of the group to add the chunk to as a bookmark

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to add a chunk to a group (bookmark it)

204.description: Confirmation that the chunk was added to the group (bookmark'ed).

400.description: Service error relating to getting the groups that the chunk is in.

delete.description:
Remove Chunk from Group

Route to remove a chunk from a group.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: Id of the group to remove the bookmark'ed chunk from

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to cretea a chunkGroup

204.description: Confirmation that the chunk was removed to the group

400.description: Service error relating to removing the chunk from the group

post.description:
Get Groups for Chunks

Route to get the groups that a chunk is in.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to get the groups that a chunk is in

200.description: JSON body representing the groups that the chunk is in

400.description: Service error relating to getting the groups that the chunk is in

post.description:
Search Over Groups

This route allows you to get groups as results instead of chunks. Each group returned will have the matching chunks sorted by similarity within the group. This is useful for when you want to get groups of chunks which are similar to the search query. If choosing hybrid search, the results will be re-ranked using BAAI/bge-reranker-large. Compatible with semantic, fulltext, or hybrid search modes.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to semantically search over groups

200.description: Group chunks which are similar to the embedding vector of the search query

400.description: Service error relating to getting the groups that the chunk is in

post.description:
Get Recommended Groups

Route to get recommended groups. This route will return groups which are similar to the groups in the request body.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to get recommendations of chunks similar to the chunks in the request

200.description: JSON body representing the groups which are similar to the groups in the request

400.description: Service error relating to to getting similar chunks

post.description:
Search Within Group

This route allows you to search only within a group. This is useful for when you only want search results to contain chunks which are members of a specific group. If choosing hybrid search, the results will be re-ranked using BAAI/bge-reranker-large.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to semantically search a group

200.description: Group chunks which are similar to the embedding vector of the search query

400.description: Service error relating to getting the groups that the chunk is in

get.summary: Get Chunks in Group by Tracking ID
get.description:
Get Chunks in Group by Tracking ID

Route to get all chunks for a group. The response is paginated, with each page containing 10 chunks. Support for custom page size is coming soon. Page is 1-indexed.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

parameters.name: group_tracking_id
parameters.description: The id of the group to get the chunks from

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of chunks to get from the group

200.description: Chunks present within the specified group

400.description: Service error relating to getting the groups that the chunk is in

get.description:
Get Group by Tracking ID

Fetch the group with the given tracking id.
get_group_by_tracking_id

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

parameters.name: tracking_id
parameters.description: The tracking id of the group to fetch.

200.description: JSON body representing the group with the given tracking id

400.description: Service error relating to getting the group with the given tracking id

post.summary: Add Chunk to Group by Tracking ID
post.description:
Add Chunk to Group by Tracking ID

Route to add a chunk to a group by tracking id.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

parameters.name: tracking_id
parameters.description: Id of the group to add the chunk to as a bookmark

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to add a chunk to a group (bookmark it)

204.description: Confirmation that the chunk was added to the group (bookmark'ed).

400.description: Service error relating to getting the groups that the chunk is in.

put.description:
Update Group by Tracking ID

Update a chunk_group with the given tracking id.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

parameters.name: tracking_id
parameters.description: Tracking id of the chunk_group to update

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to update a chunkGroup

204.description: Confirmation that the chunkGroup was updated

400.description: Service error relating to updating the chunkGroup

delete.description:
Delete Group by Tracking ID

Delete a chunk_group with the given tracking id.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

parameters.name: tracking_id
parameters.description: Tracking id of the chunk_group to delete

204.description: Confirmation that the chunkGroup was deleted

400.description: Service error relating to deleting the chunkGroup

get.description:
Get Group

Fetch the group with the given id.
get_group

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: Id of the group you want to fetch.

200.description: JSON body representing the group with the given tracking id

400.description: Service error relating to getting the group with the given tracking id

delete.description:
Delete Group

This will delete a chunk_group. If you set delete_chunks to true, it will also delete the chunks within the group.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: Id of the group you want to fetch.

parameters.name: delete_chunks
parameters.description: Delete the chunks within the group

204.description: Confirmation that the chunkGroup was deleted

400.description: Service error relating to deleting the chunkGroup

get.description:
Get Chunks in Group

Route to get all chunks for a group. The response is paginated, with each page containing 10 chunks. Page is 1-indexed.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: Id of the group you want to fetch.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of chunks to get from the group

200.description: Chunks present within the specified group

400.description: Service error relating to getting the groups that the chunk is in

post.description:
Create dataset

Create a new dataset. The auth'ed user must be an owner of the organization to create a dataset.

parameters.name: TR-Organization
parameters.description: The organization id to use for the request

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to create a new dataset

200.description: Dataset created successfully

400.description: Service error relating to creating the dataset

put.description:
Update Dataset

Update a dataset. The auth'ed user must be an owner of the organization to update a dataset.

parameters.name: TR-Organization
parameters.description: The organization id to use for the request

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to update a dataset

200.description: Dataset updated successfully

400.description: Service error relating to updating the dataset

get.description:
Get Client Configuration

Get the client configuration for a dataset. Will use the TR-D

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

200.description: Dataset environment variables

400.description: Service error relating to retrieving the dataset. Typically this only happens when your auth credentials are invalid.

get.description:
Get Files for Dataset

Get all files which belong to a given dataset specified by the dataset_id parameter. 10 files are returned per page.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

parameters.name: dataset_id
parameters.description: The id of the dataset to fetch files for.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number of files you wish to fetch. Each page contains at most 10 files.

200.description: JSON body representing the files in the current dataset

400.description: Service error relating to getting the files in the current datase

get.description:
Get Groups for Dataset

Fetch the groups which belong to a dataset specified by its id.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

parameters.name: dataset_id
parameters.description: The id of the dataset to fetch groups for.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of groups to fetch. Page is 1-indexed.

200.description: JSON body representing the groups created by the given dataset

400.description: Service error relating to getting the groups created by the given dataset

get.description:
Get Datasets from Organization

Get all datasets for an organization. The auth'ed user must be an admin or owner of the organization to get its datasets.

parameters.name: TR-Organization
parameters.description: The organization id to use for the request

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: id of the organization you want to retrieve datasets for

200.description: Datasets retrieved successfully

400.description: Service error relating to retrieving the dataset

get.description:
Get Dataset

Get a dataset by id. The auth'ed user must be an admin or owner of the organization to get a dataset.

parameters.name: TR-Organization
parameters.description: The organization id to use for the request

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

parameters.name: dataset_id
parameters.description: The id of the dataset you want to retrieve.

200.description: Dataset retrieved successfully

400.description: Service error relating to retrieving the dataset

delete.description:
Delete Dataset

Delete a dataset. The auth'ed user must be an owner of the organization to delete a dataset.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

parameters.name: dataset_id
parameters.description: The id of the dataset you want to delete.

400.description: Service error relating to deleting the dataset

post.description:
Get events for the dataset

Get events for the dataset specified by the TR-Dataset header.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to get events for a dataset

200.description: Events for the dataset

400.description: Service error relating to getting events for the dataset

post.description:
Upload File

Upload a file to S3 attached to the server. The file will be converted to HTML with tika and chunked algorithmically, images will be OCR'ed with tesseract. The resulting chunks will be indexed and searchable. Optionally, you can only upload the file and manually create chunks associated to the file after. See docs.trieve.ai and/or contact us for more details and tips. Auth'ed user must be an admin or owner of the dataset's organization to upload a file.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to upload a file

200.description: Confirmation that the file is uploading

400.description: Service error relating to uploading the file

get.description:
Get File

Download a file based on its id.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The id of the file to fetch

200.description: The signed s3 url corresponding to the file_id requested

400.description: Service error relating to finding the file

delete.description:
Delete File

Delete a file from S3 attached to the server based on its id. This will disassociate chunks from the file, but only delete them all together if you specify delete_chunks to be true. Auth'ed user must be an admin or owner of the dataset's organization to delete a file.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The id of the file to delete

parameters.name: delete_chunks
parameters.description: Whether or not to delete the chunks associated with the file

204.description: Confirmation that the file has been deleted

400.description: Service error relating to finding or deleting the file

get.description:
Health Check

Confirmation that the service is healthy and can make embedding vectors

200.description: Confirmation that the service is healthy and can make embedding vectors

400.description: Service error relating to making an embedding or overall service health

post.description:
Send Invitation

Invitations act as a way to invite users to join an organization. After a user is invited, they will automatically be added to the organization with the role specified in the invitation once they set their.

parameters.name: TR-Organization
parameters.description: The organization id to use for the request

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to send an invitation

204.description: Ok response. Indicates that invitation email was sent correctly.

400.description: Invalid email or some other error

post.description:
Create a message

Create a message. Messages are attached to topics in order to coordinate memory of gen-AI chat sessions. We are considering refactoring this resource of the API soon. Currently, you can only send user messages. If the topic is a RAG topic then the response will include Chunks first on the stream. The structure will look like `[chunks]||mesage`. See docs.trieve.ai for more information.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to create a message completion

200.description: This will be a JSON response of a string containing the LLM's generated inference. Response if not streaming.

400.description: Service error relating to getting a chat completion

put.description:
Edit a message

Edit a message which exists within the topic's chat history. This will delete the message and replace it with a new message. The new message will be generated by the AI based on the new content provided in the request body. The response will include Chunks first on the stream if the topic is using RAG. The structure will look like `[chunks]||mesage`. See docs.trieve.ai for more information.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to edit a message and get a new stream

200.description: This will be a HTTP stream, check the chat or search UI for an example how to process this

400.description: Service error relating to getting a chat completion

delete.description:
Regenerate message

Regenerate the assistant response to the last user message of a topic. This will delete the last message and replace it with a new message. The response will include Chunks first on the stream if the topic is using RAG. The structure will look like `[chunks]||mesage`. See docs.trieve.ai for more information.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to delete an agent message then regenerate it in a strem

200.description: This will be a JSON response of a string containing the LLM's generated inference. Response if not streaming.

400.description: Service error relating to getting a chat completion

get.summary: Get all messages for a given topic
get.description:
Get all messages for a given topic

Get all messages for a given topic. If the topic is a RAG topic then the response will include Chunks first on each message. The structure will look like `[chunks]||mesage`. See docs.trieve.ai for more information.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

parameters.name: messages_topic_id
parameters.description: The ID of the topic to get messages for.

200.description: All messages relating to the topic with the given ID

400.description: Service error relating to getting the messages

post.description:
Create Organization

Create a new organization. The auth'ed user who creates the organization will be the default owner of the organization.

requestBody.description: The organization data that you want to create

200.description: Created organization object

400.description: Service error relating to creating the organization

put.description:
Update Organization

Update an organization. Only the owner of the organization can update it.

parameters.name: TR-Organization
parameters.description: The organization id to use for the request

requestBody.description: The organization data that you want to update

200.description: Updated organization object

400.description: Service error relating to updating the organization

get.description:
Get Organization Usage

Fetch the current usage specification of an organization by its id. The auth'ed user must be an admin or owner of the organization to fetch it.

parameters.name: TR-Organization
parameters.description: The organization id to use for the request

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The id of the organization you want to fetch the usage of.

200.description: The current usage of the specified organization

400.description: Service error relating to finding the organization's usage by id

get.description:
Get Organization Users

Fetch the users of an organization by its id. The auth'ed user must be an admin or owner of the organization to fetch it.

parameters.name: TR-Organization
parameters.description: The organization id to use for the request

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The id of the organization you want to fetch the users of.

200.description: Array of users who belong to the specified by organization

400.description: Service error relating to finding the organization's users by id

get.description:
Get Organization

Fetch the details of an organization by its id. The auth'ed user must be an admin or owner of the organization to fetch it.

parameters.name: TR-Organization
parameters.description: The organization id to use for the request

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The id of the organization you want to fetch.

200.description: Organization with the id that was requested

400.description: Service error relating to finding the organization by id

delete.description:
Delete Organization

Delete an organization by its id. The auth'ed user must be an owner of the organization to delete it.

parameters.name: TR-Organization
parameters.description: The organization id to use for the request

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The id of the organization you want to fetch.

200.description: Confirmation that the organization was deleted

400.description: Service error relating to deleting the organization by id

get.description:
Checkout

Get a direct link to the stripe checkout page for the plan and organization

parameters.name: plan_id
parameters.description: id of the plan you want to subscribe to

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: id of the organization you want to subscribe to the plan

303.description: SeeOther response redirecting user to stripe checkout page

400.description: Service error relating to creating a URL for a stripe checkout page

get.description:
Get All Plans

Get a list of all plans

200.description: List of all plans

400.description: Service error relating to getting all plans

delete.description:
Cancel Subscription

Cancel a subscription by its id

parameters.name: TR-Organization
parameters.description: The organization id to use for the request

parameters.name: subscription_id
parameters.description: id of the subscription you want to cancel

200.description: Confirmation that the subscription was cancelled

400.description: Service error relating to creating a URL for a stripe checkout page

patch.description:
Update Subscription Plan

Update a subscription to a new plan

parameters.name: TR-Organization
parameters.description: The organization id to use for the request

parameters.name: subscription_id
parameters.description: id of the subscription you want to update

parameters.name: plan_id
parameters.description: id of the plan you want to subscribe to

200.description: Confirmation that the subscription was updated to the new plan

400.description: Service error relating to updating the subscription to the new plan

post.description:
Create Topic

Create a new chat topic. Topics are attached to a user and act as a coordinator for memory of gen-AI chat sessions. We are considering refactoring this resource of the API soon.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to create chat topic

200.description: The JSON response payload containing the created topic

400.description: Topic name empty or a service error

put.description:
Update Topic

Update an existing chat topic. Currently, only the name of the topic can be updated.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to update a chat topic

204.description: Confirmation that the topic was updated

400.description: Service error relating to topic update

get.description:
Get All Topics for User

Get all topics belonging to a the auth'ed user. Soon, we plan to allow specification of the user for this route and include pagination.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The id of the user to get topics for

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

200.description: All topics belonging to a given user

400.description: Service error relating to topic get

delete.description:
Delete Topic

Delete an existing chat topic. When a topic is deleted, all associated chat messages are also deleted.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id to use for the request

parameters.name: topic_id
parameters.description: The id of the topic you want to delete.

204.description: Confirmation that the topic was deleted

400.description: Service error relating to topic deletion

put.description:
Update User

Update a user's information. If the user_id is not provided, the auth'ed user will be updated. If the user_id is provided, the auth'ed user must be an admin (1) or owner (2) of the organization.

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to update user information for the auth'ed user

200.description: JSON body representing the updated user information

400.description: Service error relating to updating the user

delete.description:
Delete User Api Key

Delete an api key for the auth'ed user.

parameters.name: api_key_id
parameters.description: The id of the api key to delete

200.description: JSON body representing the api_key for the user

400.description: Service error relating to creating api_key for the user

post.description:
Set User Api Key

Create a new api key for the auth'ed user. Successful response will contain the newly created api key. If a write role is assigned the api key will have permission level of the auth'ed user who calls this endpoint.

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to create a new user api key

200.description: JSON body representing the api_key for the user

400.description: Service error relating to creating api_key for the user

chunk_id.description: Id of the chunk to make a member of the group.

tracking_id.description: Tracking Id of the chunk to make a member of the group.

inv_code.description: Code sent via email as a result of successful call to send_invitation

organization_id.description: ID of organization to authenticate into

redirect_uri.description: URL to redirect to after successful login

pos_in_queue.description: The current position the last access item is in the queue

chunk_html.description: HTML content of the chunk. This can also be plaintext. The innerText of the HTML will be used to create the embedding vector. The point of using HTML is for convienience, as some users have applications where users submit HTML content.

chunk_vector.description: Chunk_vector is a vector of floats which can be used instead of generating a new embedding. This is useful for when you are using a pre-embedded dataset. If this is not provided, the innerText of the chunk_html will be used to create the embedding.

file_id.description: File_uuid is the uuid of the file that the chunk is associated with. This is used to associate chunks with files. This is useful for when you want to delete a file and all of its associated chunks.

group_ids.description: Group ids are the ids of the groups that the chunk should be placed into. This is useful for when you want to create a chunk and add it to a group or multiple groups in one request. Necessary because this route queues the chunk for ingestion and the chunk may not exist yet immediately after response.

group_tracking_ids.description: Group tracking_ids are the tracking_ids of the groups that the chunk should be placed into. This is useful for when you want to create a chunk and add it to a group or multiple groups in one request. Necessary because this route queues the chunk for ingestion and the chunk may not exist yet immediately after response.

link.description: Link to the chunk. This can also be any string. Frequently, this is a link to the source of the chunk. The link value will not affect the embedding creation.

metadata.description: Metadata is a JSON object which can be used to filter chunks. This is useful for when you want to filter chunks by arbitrary metadata. Unlike with tag filtering, there is a performance hit for filtering on metadata.

split_avg.description: Split avg is a boolean which tells the server to split the text in the chunk_html into smaller chunks and average their resulting vectors. This is useful for when you want to create a chunk from a large piece of text and want to split it into smaller chunks to create a more fuzzy average dense vector. The sparse vector will be generated normally with no averaging. By default this is false.

tag_set.description: Tag set is a list of tags. This can be used to filter chunks by tag. Unlike with metadata filtering, HNSW indices will exist for each tag such that there is not a performance hit for filtering on them.

time_stamp.description: Time_stamp should be an ISO 8601 combined date and time without timezone. It is used for time window filtering and recency-biasing search results.

tracking_id.description: Tracking_id is a string which can be used to identify a chunk. This is useful for when you are coordinating with an external system and want to use the tracking_id to identify the chunk.

upsert_by_tracking_id.description: Upsert when a chunk with the same tracking_id exists. By default this is false, and the request will fail if a chunk with the same tracking_id exists. If this is true, the chunk will be updated if a chunk with the same tracking_id exists.

weight.description: Weight is a float which can be used to bias search results. This is useful for when you want to bias search results for a chunk. The magnitude only matters relative to other chunks in the chunk's dataset dataset.

must.description: All of these field conditions have to match for the chunk to be included in the result set.

must_not.description: None of these field conditions can match for the chunk to be included in the result set.

should.description: Only one of these field conditions has to match for the chunk to be included in the result set.

description.description: Description to assign to the chunk_group. Convenience field for you to avoid having to remember what the group is for.

metadata.description: Optional metadata to assign to the chunk_group. This is a JSON object that can store any additional information you want to associate with the chunks inside of the chunk_group.

name.description: Name to assign to the chunk_group. Does not need to be unique.

tag_set.description: Optional tags to assign to the chunk_group. This is a list of strings that can be used to categorize the chunks inside the chunk_group.

tracking_id.description: Optional tracking id to assign to the chunk_group. This is a unique identifier for the chunk_group.

client_configuration.description: Client configuration for the dataset, can be arbitrary JSON. We recommend setting to `{}` to start. See docs.trieve.ai for more information or adjust with the admin dashboard.

dataset_name.description: Name of the dataset. Must be unique within the organization.

organization_id.description: Organization ID that the dataset will belong to.

server_configuration.description: Server configuration for the dataset, can be arbitrary JSON. We recommend setting to `{}` to start. See docs.trieve.ai for more information or adjust with the admin dashboard.

highlight_citations.description: Whether or not to highlight the citations in the response. If this is set to true or not included, the citations will be highlighted. If this is set to false, the citations will not be highlighted. Default is true.

highlight_delimiters.description: The delimiters to use for highlighting the citations. If this is not included, the default delimiters will be used. Default is `[".", "!", "?", "\n", "\t", ","]`.

model.description: The model to use for the assistant's messages. This can be any model from the openrouter model list. If no model is provided, gpt-3.5-turbo will be used.

new_message_content.description: The content of the user message to attach to the topic and then generate an assistant message in response to.

stream_response.description: Whether or not to stream the response. If this is set to true or not included, the response will be a stream. If this is set to false, the response will be a normal JSON response. Default is true.

topic_id.description: The ID of the topic to attach the message to.

name.description: The arbitrary name which will be used to identify the organization. This name must be unique.

first_user_message.description: The first message which will belong to the topic. The topic name is generated based on this message similar to how it works in the OpenAI chat UX if a name is not explicitly provided on the name request body key.

model.description: The model to use for the assistant's messages. This can be any model from the openrouter model list. If no model is provided, the gpt-3.5-turbo will be used.

name.description: The name of the topic. If this is not provided, the topic name is generated from the first_user_message.

topic_id.description: The id of the topic to target.

api_key_id.description: The id of the api key to delete.

highlight_citations.description: Whether or not to highlight the citations in the response. If this is set to true or not included, the citations will be highlighted. If this is set to false, the citations will not be highlighted. Default is true.

highlight_delimiters.description: The delimiters to use for highlighting the citations. If this is not included, the default delimiters will be used. Default is `[".", "!", "?", "\n", "\t", ","]`.

message_sort_order.description: The sort order of the message to edit.

model.description: The model to use for the assistant generative inferences. This can be any model from the openrouter model list. If no model is provided, the gpt-3.5-turbo will be used.~

new_message_content.description: The new content of the message to replace the old content with.

stream_response.description: Whether or not to stream the response. If this is set to true or not included, the response will be a stream. If this is set to false, the response will be a normal JSON response. Default is true.

topic_id.description: The id of the topic to edit the message at the given sort order for.

field.description: Field is the name of the field to filter on. The field value will be used to check for an exact substring match on the metadata values for each existing chunk. This is useful for when you want to filter chunks by arbitrary metadata. To access fields inside of the metadata that you provide with the card, prefix the field name with `metadata.`.

match.description: Match is the value to match on the field. The match value will be used to check for an exact substring match on the metadata values for each existing chunk. This is useful for when you want to filter chunks by arbitrary metadata.

chunk_ids.description: The ids of the chunks to be retrieved and injected into the context window for RAG.

model.description: The model to use for the chat. This can be any model from the openrouter model list. If no model is provided, gpt-3.5-turbo will be used.

prev_messages.description: The previous messages to be placed into the chat history. The last message in this array will be the prompt for the model to inference on. The length of this array must be at least 1.

prompt.description: Prompt for the last message in the prev_messages array. This will be used to generate the next message in the chat. The default is 'Respond to the instruction and include the doc numbers that you used in square brackets at the end of the sentences that you used the docs for:'. You can also specify an empty string to leave the final message alone such that your user's final message can be used as the prompt. See docs.trieve.ai or contact us for more information.

stream_response.description: Whether or not to stream the response. If this is set to true or not included, the response will be a stream. If this is set to false, the response will be a normal JSON response. Default is true.

prev_messages.content: I am going to provide several pieces of information (docs) for you to use in response to a request or question.

example.prompt: Respond to the instruction and include the doc numbers that you used in square brackets at the end of the sentences that you used the docs for:

event_types.description: The types of events to get. Any combination of file_uploaded, card_uploaded, card_action_failed, or card_updated. Leave undefined to get all events.

page.description: The page number to get. Default is 1.

page_size.description: The number of items per page. Default is 10.

app_url.description: The url of the app that the user will be directed to in order to set their password. Usually admin.trieve.ai, but may differ for local dev or self-hosted setups.

email.description: The email of the user to invite. Must be a valid email as they will be sent an email to register.

organization_id.description: The id of the organization to invite the user to.

redirect_uri.description: The url that the user will be redirected to after setting their password.

user_role.description: The role the user will have in the organization. 0 = User, 1 = Admin, 2 = Owner.

limit.description: The number of chunks to return. This is the number of chunks which will be returned in the response. The default is 10.

negative_chunk_ids.description: The ids of the chunks to be used as negative examples for the recommendation. The chunks in this array will be used to filter out similar chunks.

negative_tracking_ids.description: The tracking_ids of the chunks to be used as negative examples for the recommendation. The chunks in this array will be used to filter out similar chunks.

positive_chunk_ids.description: The ids of the chunks to be used as positive examples for the recommendation. The chunks in this array will be used to find similar chunks.

positive_tracking_ids.description: The tracking_ids of the chunks to be used as positive examples for the recommendation. The chunks in this array will be used to find similar chunks.

slim_chunks.description: Set slim_chunks to true to avoid returning the content and chunk_html of the chunks. This is useful for when you want to reduce amount of data over the wire for latency improvement. Default is false.

strategy.description: Strategy to use for recommendations, either "average_vector" or "best_score". The default is "average_vector". The "average_vector" strategy will construct a single average vector from the positive and negative samples then use it to perform a pseudo-search. The "best_score" strategy is more advanced and navigates the HNSW with a heuristic of picking edges where the point is closer to the positive samples than it is the negatives.

group_size.description: The number of chunks to fetch for each group. This is the number of chunks which will be returned in the response for each group. The default is 3. If this is set to a large number, we recommend setting slim_chunks to true to avoid returning the content and chunk_html of the chunks so as to reduce latency due to content download and serialization.

limit.description: The number of groups to return. This is the number of groups which will be returned in the response. The default is 10.

negative_group_ids.description: The ids of the groups to be used as negative examples for the recommendation. The groups in this array will be used to filter out similar groups.

negative_group_tracking_ids.description: The ids of the groups to be used as negative examples for the recommendation. The groups in this array will be used to filter out similar groups.

positive_group_ids.description: The ids of the groups to be used as positive examples for the recommendation. The groups in this array will be used to find similar groups.

positive_group_tracking_ids.description: The ids of the groups to be used as positive examples for the recommendation. The groups in this array will be used to find similar groups.

slim_chunks.description: Set slim_chunks to true to avoid returning the content and chunk_html of the chunks. This is useful for when you want to reduce amount of data over the wire for latency improvement. Default is false.

strategy.description: Strategy to use for recommendations, either "average_vector" or "best_score". The default is "average_vector". The "average_vector" strategy will construct a single average vector from the positive and negative samples then use it to perform a pseudo-search. The "best_score" strategy is more advanced and navigates the HNSW with a heuristic of picking edges where the point is closer to the positive samples than it is the negatives.

highlight_citations.description: Whether or not to highlight the citations in the response. If this is set to true or not included, the citations will be highlighted. If this is set to false, the citations will not be highlighted. Default is true.

highlight_delimiters.description: The delimiters to use for highlighting the citations. If this is not included, the default delimiters will be used. Default is `[".", "!", "?", "\n", "\t", ","]`.

model.description: The model to use for the assistant generative inferences. This can be any model from the openrouter model list. If no model is provided, the gpt-3.5-turbo will be used.~

stream_response.description: Whether or not to stream the response. If this is set to true or not included, the response will be a stream. If this is set to false, the response will be a normal JSON response. Default is true.

topic_id.description: The id of the topic to regenerate the last message for.

date_bias.description: Set date_bias to true to bias search results towards more recent chunks. This will work best in hybrid search mode.

get_collisions.description: Set get_collisions to true to get the collisions for each chunk. This will only apply if environment variable COLLISIONS_ENABLED is set to true.

highlight_delimiters.description: Set highlight_delimiters to a list of strings to use as delimiters for highlighting. If not specified, this defaults to ["?", ",", ".", "!"].

highlight_results.description: Set highlight_results to true to highlight the results. If not specified, this defaults to true.

page.description: Page of chunks to fetch. Page is 1-indexed.

page_size.description: Page size is the number of chunks to fetch. This can be used to fetch more than 10 chunks at a time.

query.description: Query is the search query. This can be any string. The query will be used to create an embedding vector and/or SPLADE vector which will be used to find the result set.

score_threshold.description: Set score_threshold to a float to filter out chunks with a score below the threshold.

search_type.description: Can be either "semantic", "fulltext", or "hybrid". "hybrid" will pull in one page (10 chunks) of both semantic and full-text results then re-rank them using BAAI/bge-reranker-large. "semantic" will pull in one page (10 chunks) of the nearest cosine distant vectors. "fulltext" will pull in one page (10 chunks) of full-text results based on SPLADE.

slim_chunks.description: Set slim_chunks to true to avoid returning the content and chunk_html of the chunks. This is useful for when you want to reduce amount of data over the wire for latency improvement. Default is false.

use_weights.description: Set use_weights to true to use the weights of the chunks in the result set in order to sort them. If not specified, this defaults to true.

get_collisions.description: Set get_collisions to true to get the collisions for each chunk. This will only apply if environment variable COLLISIONS_ENABLED is set to true.

group_size.description: Group_size is the number of chunks to fetch for each group. The default is 3. If a group has less than group_size chunks, all chunks will be returned. If this is set to a large number, we recommend setting slim_chunks to true to avoid returning the content and chunk_html of the chunks so as to lower the amount of time required for content download and serialization.

highlight_delimiters.description: Set highlight_delimiters to a list of strings to use as delimiters for highlighting. If not specified, this defaults to ["?", ",", ".", "!"].

highlight_results.description: Set highlight_results to true to highlight the results. If not specified, this defaults to true.

page.description: Page of group results to fetch. Page is 1-indexed.

page_size.description: Page size is the number of group results to fetch. The default is 10.

query.description: Query is the search query. This can be any string. The query will be used to create an embedding vector and/or SPLADE vector which will be used to find the result set.

score_threshold.description: Set score_threshold to a float to filter out chunks with a score below the threshold.

search_type.description: Can be either "semantic", "fulltext", or "hybrid". "hybrid" will pull in one page (10 chunks) of both semantic and full-text results then re-rank them using BAAI/bge-reranker-large. "semantic" will pull in one page (10 chunks) of the nearest cosine distant vectors. "fulltext" will pull in one page (10 chunks) of full-text results based on SPLADE.

slim_chunks.description: Set slim_chunks to true to avoid returning the content and chunk_html of the chunks. This is useful for when you want to reduce amount of data over the wire for latency improvement. Default is false.

date_bias.description: Set date_bias to true to bias search results towards more recent chunks. This will work best in hybrid search mode.

group_id.description: Group specifies the group to search within. Results will only consist of chunks which are bookmarks within the specified group.

group_tracking_id.description: Group_tracking_id specifies the group to search within by tracking id. Results will only consist of chunks which are bookmarks within the specified group. If both group_id and group_tracking_id are provided, group_id will be used.

highlight_delimiters.description: Set highlight_delimiters to a list of strings to use as delimiters for highlighting. If not specified, this defaults to ["?", ",", ".", "!"].

highlight_results.description: Set highlight_results to true to highlight the results. If not specified, this defaults to true.

page.description: The page of chunks to fetch. Page is 1-indexed.

page_size.description: The page size is the number of chunks to fetch. This can be used to fetch more than 10 chunks at a time.

query.description: The query is the search query. This can be any string. The query will be used to create an embedding vector and/or SPLADE vector which will be used to find the result set.

score_threshold.description: Set score_threshold to a float to filter out chunks with a score below the threshold.

search_type.description: Search_type can be either "semantic", "fulltext", or "hybrid". "hybrid" will pull in one page (10 chunks) of both semantic and full-text results then re-rank them using BAAI/bge-reranker-large. "semantic" will pull in one page (10 chunks) of the nearest cosine distant vectors. "fulltext" will pull in one page (10 chunks) of full-text results based on SPLADE.

slim_chunks.description: Set slim_chunks to true to avoid returning the content and chunk_html of the chunks. This is useful for when you want to reduce amount of data over the wire for latency improvement. Default is false.

use_weights.description: Set use_weights to true to use the weights of the chunks in the result set in order to sort them. If not specified, this defaults to true.

name.description: The name which will be assigned to the new api key.

role.description: The role which will be assigned to the new api key. Either 0 (read), 1 (read and write at the level of the currently auth'ed user). The auth'ed user must have a role greater than or equal to the role being assigned which means they must be an admin (1) or owner (2) of the organization to assign write permissions with a role of 1.

api_key.description: The api key which was created. This is the value which should be used in the Authorization header.

pos_in_queue.description: The current position the last access item is in the queue

query.description: The query to base the generated suggested queries off of.

chunk_html.description: HTML content of the chunk you want to update. This can also be plaintext. The innerText of the HTML will be used to create the embedding vector. The point of using HTML is for convienience, as some users have applications where users submit HTML content. If no chunk_html is provided, the existing chunk_html will be used.

group_ids.description: Group ids are the ids of the groups that the chunk should be placed into. This is useful for when you want to update a chunk and add it to a group or multiple groups in one request.

group_tracking_ids.description: Group tracking_ids are the tracking_ids of the groups that the chunk should be placed into. This is useful for when you want to update a chunk and add it to a group or multiple groups in one request.

link.description: Link of the chunk you want to update. This can also be any string. Frequently, this is a link to the source of the chunk. The link value will not affect the embedding creation. If no link is provided, the existing link will be used.

metadata.description: The metadata is a JSON object which can be used to filter chunks. This is useful for when you want to filter chunks by arbitrary metadata. Unlike with tag filtering, there is a performance hit for filtering on metadata. If no metadata is provided, the existing metadata will be used.

time_stamp.description: Time_stamp should be an ISO 8601 combined date and time without timezone. It is used for time window filtering and recency-biasing search results. If no time_stamp is provided, the existing time_stamp will be used.

tracking_id.description: Tracking_id of the chunk you want to update. This is required to match an existing chunk.

weight.description: Weight is a float which can be used to bias search results. This is useful for when you want to bias search results for a chunk. The magnitude only matters relative to other chunks in the chunk's dataset dataset. If no weight is provided, the existing weight will be used.

chunk_html.description: HTML content of the chunk you want to update. This can also be plaintext. The innerText of the HTML will be used to create the embedding vector. The point of using HTML is for convienience, as some users have applications where users submit HTML content. If no chunk_html is provided, the existing chunk_html will be used.

chunk_id.description: Id of the chunk you want to update. You can provide either the chunk_id or the tracking_id. If both are provided, the chunk_id will be used.

group_ids.description: Group ids are the ids of the groups that the chunk should be placed into. This is useful for when you want to update a chunk and add it to a group or multiple groups in one request.

group_tracking_ids.description: Group tracking_ids are the tracking_ids of the groups that the chunk should be placed into. This is useful for when you want to update a chunk and add it to a group or multiple groups in one request.

link.description: Link of the chunk you want to update. This can also be any string. Frequently, this is a link to the source of the chunk. The link value will not affect the embedding creation. If no link is provided, the existing link will be used.

metadata.description: The metadata is a JSON object which can be used to filter chunks. This is useful for when you want to filter chunks by arbitrary metadata. Unlike with tag filtering, there is a performance hit for filtering on metadata. If no metadata is provided, the existing metadata will be used.

tag_set.description: Tag set is a list of tags. This can be used to filter chunks by tag. Unlike with metadata filtering, HNSW indices will exist for each tag such that there is not a performance hit for filtering on them. If no tag_set is provided, the existing tag_set will be used.

time_stamp.description: Time_stamp should be an ISO 8601 combined date and time without timezone. It is used for time window filtering and recency-biasing search results. If no time_stamp is provided, the existing time_stamp will be used.

tracking_id.description: Tracking_id of the chunk you want to update. This is required to match an existing chunk.

weight.description: Weight is a float which can be used to bias search results. This is useful for when you want to bias search results for a chunk. The magnitude only matters relative to other chunks in the chunk's dataset dataset. If no weight is provided, the existing weight will be used.

description.description: Description to assign to the chunk_group. Convenience field for you to avoid having to remember what the group is for. If not provided, the description will not be updated.

group_id.description: Id of the chunk_group to update.

metadata.description: Optional metadata to assign to the chunk_group. This is a JSON object that can store any additional information you want to associate with the chunks inside of the chunk_group.

name.description: Name to assign to the chunk_group. Does not need to be unique. If not provided, the name will not be updated.

tag_set.description: Optional tags to assign to the chunk_group. This is a list of strings that can be used to categorize the chunks inside the chunk_group.

tracking_id.description: Tracking Id of the chunk_group to update.

client_configuration.description: The new client configuration of the dataset, can be arbitrary JSON. See docs.trieve.ai for more information. If not provided, the client configuration will not be updated.

dataset_id.description: The id of the dataset you want to update.

dataset_name.description: The new name of the dataset. Must be unique within the organization. If not provided, the name will not be updated.

server_configuration.description: The new server configuration of the dataset, can be arbitrary JSON. See docs.trieve.ai for more information. If not provided, the server configuration will not be updated.

description.description: Description to assign to the chunk_group. Convenience field for you to avoid having to remember what the group is for. If not provided, the description will not be updated.

metadata.description: Optional metadata to assign to the chunk_group. This is a JSON object that can store any additional information you want to associate with the chunks inside of the chunk_group.

name.description: Name to assign to the chunk_group. Does not need to be unique. If not provided, the name will not be updated.

tag_set.description: Optional tags to assign to the chunk_group. This is a list of strings that can be used to categorize the chunks inside the chunk_group.

tracking_id.description: Tracking Id of the chunk_group to update.

name.description: The new name of the organization. If not provided, the name will not be updated.

organization_id.description: The id of the organization to update.

name.description: The new name of the topic. A name is not generated from this field, it is used as-is.

topic_id.description: The id of the topic to target.

name.description: In the sense of a legal name, not a username. The new name to assign to the user, if not provided, the current name will be used.

organization_id.description: The id of the organization to update the user for.

role.description: Either 0 (user), 1 (admin), or 2 (owner). If not provided, the current role will be used. The auth'ed user must have a role greater than or equal to the role being assigned.

user_id.description: The id of the user to update, if not provided, the auth'ed user will be updated. If provided, the auth'ed user must be an admin (1) or owner (2) of the organization.

base64_file.description: Base64 encoded file. Convert + to -, / to _, and remove the ending = if present. This is the standard base64url encoding.

create_chunks.description: Create chunks is a boolean which determines whether or not to create chunks from the file. If false, you can manually chunk the file and send the chunks to the create_chunk endpoint with the file_id to associate chunks with the file. Meant mostly for advanced users.

description.description: Description is an optional convience field so you do not have to remember what the file contains or is about. It will be included on the group resulting from the file which will hold its chunk.

file_mime_type.description: MIME type of the file being uploaded.

file_name.description: Name of the file being uploaded, including the extension.

link.description: Link to the file. This can also be any string. This can be used to filter when searching for the file's resulting chunks. The link value will not affect embedding creation.

metadata.description: Metadata is a JSON object which can be used to filter chunks. This is useful for when you want to filter chunks by arbitrary metadata. Unlike with tag filtering, there is a performance hit for filtering on metadata. Will be passed down to the file's chunks.

tag_set.description: Tag set is a comma separated list of tags which will be passed down to the chunks made from the file. Tags are used to filter chunks when searching. HNSW indices are created for each tag such that there is no performance loss when filtering on them.

time_stamp.description: Time stamp should be an ISO 8601 combined date and time without timezone. Time_stamp is used for time window filtering and recency-biasing search results. Will be passed down to the file's chunks.

tags.name: invitation
tags.description: Invitation endpoint. Exists to invite users to an organization.

tags.name: auth
tags.description: Authentication endpoint. Serves to register and authenticate users.

tags.name: user
tags.description: User endpoint. Enables you to modify user roles and information.

tags.name: organization
tags.description: Organization endpoint. Enables you to modify organization roles and information.

tags.name: dataset
tags.description: Dataset endpoint. Datasets belong to organizations and hold configuration information for both client and server. Datasets contain chunks and chunk groups.

tags.name: chunk
tags.description: Chunk endpoint. Think of chunks as individual searchable units of information. The majority of your integration will likely be with the Chunk endpoint.

tags.name: chunk_group
tags.description: Chunk groups endpoint. Think of a chunk_group as a bookmark folder within the dataset.

tags.name: file
tags.description: File endpoint. When files are uploaded, they are stored in S3 and broken up into chunks with text extraction from Apache Tika. You can upload files of pretty much any type up to 1GB in size. See chunking algorithm details at `docs.trieve.ai` for more information on how chunking works. Improved default chunking is on our roadmap.

tags.name: events
tags.description: Notifications endpoint. Files are uploaded asynchronously and events are sent to the user when the upload is complete.

tags.name: topic
tags.description: Topic chat endpoint. Think of topics as the storage system for gen-ai chat memory. Gen AI messages belong to topics.

tags.name: message
tags.description: Message chat endpoint. Messages are units belonging to a topic in the context of a chat with a LLM. There are system, user, and assistant messages.

tags.name: stripe
tags.description: Stripe endpoint. Used for the managed SaaS version of this app. Eventually this will become a micro-service. Reach out to the team using contact info found at `docs.trieve.ai` for more information.

tags.name: health
tags.description: Health check endpoint. Used to check if the server is up and running.
